solution_line_template: Every second month Nina does twice the regular distance, which means {regular_monthly_distance} * {double_distance_factor} = <<{regular_monthly_distance}*{double_distance_factor}={double_monthly_distance}>>{double_monthly_distance} kilometers.

Two years is {years} * {months_per_year} = {total_months} months, so half of this time is {total_months} * {half_fraction} = <<{total_months}*{half_fraction}={months_each_type}>>{months_each_type} months.

So in {months_each_type} months Nina does {regular_monthly_distance} * {months_each_type} = <<{regular_monthly_distance}*{months_each_type}={distance_regular_months}>>{distance_regular_months} kilometers.

And in the other {months_each_type} months, she does {double_monthly_distance} * {months_each_type} = <<{double_monthly_distance}*{months_each_type}={distance_double_months}>>{distance_double_months} kilometers.
So in two years, Nina would be able to make {distance_regular_months} + {distance_double_months} = <<{distance_regular_months}+{distance_double_months}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers.
